abstract: Steven P. Otillar, who joined the law firm Dewey & LeBoeuf just months before it collapsed, said the bank had a legal obligation to disclose the firm’s financial state.
snippet: Steven P. Otillar, who joined the law firm Dewey & LeBoeuf just months before it collapsed, said the bank had a legal obligation to disclose the firm’s financial state.
lead_paragraph: There has been no shortage of finger-pointing since the collapse of the law firm Dewey & LeBoeuf, with most of the animus directed toward the firm’s managing partner and its broader leadership.

headline.main: Citibank Hid Firm’s Financial Troubles, Ex-Partner at Dewey & LeBoeuf Says
headline.print_headline: Citi Hid Dewey’s Finances, Ex-Partner at Firm Says
